thread.title: AIA conference placements released for next two-year scheduling block
thread.title_full: AIA conference placements released for next two-year scheduling block

title: AIA conference placements released for next two-year scheduling block
text: Greg MacAfee Reporter COTTONWOOD - On Tuesday, the Arizona Interscholastic Association released the initial conference placement for the next two-year scheduling block. With six conferences created, schools were placed into conference by enrollment and schools have until October 20 to appeal their conference placement. Local schools Mingus Union and Camp Verde High School received their placements.The Marauders were placed into Conference 4A with other schools such as Apache Junction, Bradshaw Mountain, Cactus Shadows, Coconino, Flagstaff, Moon Valley, Peoria, and Lee Williams. Conference 4A includes 42 teams in total. The Camp Verde Cowboys were placed into Conference 2A with teams such as Bisbee, AZ College Prep, Phoenix Country Day, Pinon, Tombstone, Chandler Prep, and Round Valley. Conference 2A consists of 42 teams in total for the 2016-2018 scheduling block. Again not all placements are final and teams have until October 20 to appeal. Athletic Directors from both schools say they have no plans on appealing their schools conference placement. After the October 20 deadline, conference committees will meet to review appeals and solidify conference placements between October 22 and October 30. The updated conference placements will be posted at 2 p.m. on www.aiaonline.org on November 2. Member schools have the right to appeal the Conference Committees placements and can turn an appeal into the AIA Executive Board by November 5. After the final conference placements are finalized the Conference Committees will create regions for their conferences between November 17 and November 25, and they will be posted by December 1 at 2 p.m.-- Follow Greg Macafee on Twitter @greg_macafee and Instagram @VerdeValleyNews
